Dispute_Type: Dispute over whether the respondent met Canadian citizenship residence requirements
Legal_Issue: Is the citizenship judge's decision reasonable under the standard of reasonableness?
Outcome: Appeal allowed, original decision set aside, case referred back for reassessment
Procedural_Context: Appeal by Minister after citizenship approval
Basis_of_Claim: Failure to meet Canadian citizenship residence requirements
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Unclear application of residency test, lack of clarity on evidence satisfaction
Application_Error: Failed to specify which residency test was applied, did not clarify dissatisfaction with evidence
Evidence_Ignored: Lack of clarification on which documents satisfied residence criteria
Legal_Standard: Justified, transparent, intelligible decision within acceptable range
Decision_Outcome: Original decision set aside, remanded for redetermination
Authority: Citizenship Commission or equivalent administrative body
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule: The decision must be justified, transparent, intelligible, and fall within acceptable outcomes based on facts and law.
Cause_of_Refusal: Ambiguity in reasoning regarding residency test and evidentiary satisfaction
Evidentiary_Issues: Judge did not clarify which documents satisfied residence criteria
Procedural_Fairness: Deficiency in transparency and intelligibility of decision
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of administrative decision
Omission_Type: Failure to specify residency test used, failure to assess evidence clearly
